title: Laboratory for Physical Chemistry I
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Sciences Yale College distributional requirement.
description:
Introduction to the tools and techniques of modern experimental physical chemistry, including analog/digital electronics, quantitative measurements of basic thermodynamic properties, and nuclear magnetic resonance spectrometry.

After or concurrently with CHEM 328 or 332. Meets on Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday from 1:30 to 2:20 for the first week of the term.
regnotes: Enrollment for this course is managed through Preference Selection . Students interested in CHEM 330LA should be aware of the following: 1. There are four (4) laboratory sections; however, enrollment in each is limited to a maximum of eight (8) students. Therefore, it is imperative that you rank three different sections when making preference selections to ensure everyone can be accommodated. Laboratory sections will begin on September 8th (vide infra). 2. Since CHEM 330LA is a full credit laboratory course, it meets twice a week - once for a laboratory session (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday; 1:00-5:00pm, SCL-26) and once for a lecture (Friday; 1:30-2:20pm, SCL-18). Attendance at the Friday afternoon lectures is MANDATORY. 3. During the first (partial) week of classes, only the lecture component of CHEM 330LA will meet at 1:30pm on Wednesday (09/02), Thursday (09/03), and Friday (09/04) to review material for the first experiment. Students should plan to attend all three lectures, as each will cover different topics. 4. Laboratory sessions for CHEM 330LA will commence during the second week of classes at 1:00pm on Tuesday (09/08), Wednesday (09/09), and Thursday (09/10), with the first meeting of the Monday section taking place during the following week (09/14).
rp_attr: This course meets during the Reading Period: the week between the last week of classes and finals week. Meets Reading Period
